text:
We are using PDF rendering for web-based display and PostScript for printing 
(same FO-document). The PostScript printouts are spot-on with the page margins 
specified in the simple-page-master. Exact -- I measured them with a ruler. The 
PDFs however are not. The margins are all larger by about .5cm and the content 
is shrunken down proportionally smaller.

Basically, the PostScript rendering is actually following the margins specified 
while the PDFs seem to be adding extra space alone the perimeter of the page 
shrinking down the content within the margins.
creator: chiara.l.gelinas@questdiagnostics.com
jeremias@apache.org

I'm sure that is your print setting in Acrobat Reader:
http://xml.apache.org/fop/faq.html#pdf-print-contortion
